sections.html:
Zone 2 • Measurement

pH Balance in Water

Acid/Alkaline Basics — The Hydrogen Ion Scale

pH measures the concentration of hydrogen ions (H⁺). It's a logarithmic scale from 0-14.

The pH Scale

  • pH 0-6.9 — Acidic (more H⁺ ions)
  • pH 7.0 — Neutral (pure water at 25°C)
  • pH 7.1-14 — Alkaline/Basic (fewer H⁺ ions)

Each pH unit = 10x difference in H⁺ concentration.

Typical Water pH

Common Waters

  • Distilled: 7.0 (neutral)
  • Tap water: 6.5-8.5
  • Mineral water: 7.0-8.5
  • "Alkaline" water: 8.0-10.0

What Affects pH

  • Dissolved minerals (especially carbonates)
  • CO₂ absorption from air
  • Temperature
  • Added substances

Measuring pH

  • Digital pH meter (most accurate)
  • pH test strips (convenient, less precise)
  • Liquid reagent kits (colorimetric)

Calibrate meters with pH 7.0 and pH 4.0 buffers before each session.

items.question: Is alkaline water healthier?
items.answer: The body regulates its own pH. Alkaline water claims are debated. What matters more is mineral content.

items.question: Why does pH change after sitting?
items.answer: CO₂ from air dissolves, forming carbonic acid, which lowers pH slightly.
